history.content:
Transfer student here too. Over all I feel like you are having a well-rounded ML + SWE path, and you clearly make some good plan to dive into classes like 127 and 189. I'll make some comments on the courses I've taken and the courses that I'm planning to take and have done a lot of survey on (here and friends who already took them).

Your Fall 2019 looks fine to me. Data8 is kind of a subset of 61A. 16A is not that hard in general if you are familiar with lin alg.

Your Spring 2020 will be significantly harder than Fall 2019 in my opinion, but doable if you are already familiar with data structure and willing to commit your whole time into the courses.

61B and 100 both have heavy projects (Instructors are adding more workload and material into 100). 16B's homework and labs are much more challenging than 16A. So the overall workload is like triple the Fall2019.

Your current Fall 2020 plan will be insane... 170 and 61C is enough for a semester. 127, 170 both have weekly hw assignments that are VERY challenging, 61C is also notoriously being heavy-workload-- prob the most heavy-workload lower div classes in EECS. I suggest you taking 61C during the 2020 summer(170 and 127 are not offering during the summer) then this semester's plan will be doable.

Don't have too much to say about later semesters. But I feel like you need to do some review for prob. theory before 126 since it's a challenging class. You take 70 a year ago in summer before 126 and all the courses in between do not really address the content of prob. theory.

Just my two cents. Please edit if you have things to add/against.

children.subject: CS 182 is generally not offered in the fall, so you may want to adjust your schedule to account for that.

Original responder here. Yeah I would second doing 61A during the summer. Then you can do 61B next fall, 170 at 2020 spring.

I personally finished 61A and 61B before my first semester (2018 Fall) so that I can start CS170 directly, and looking back, I feel like I do make the right decision. CS170 is a crucial class no matter which direction you are going for EECS so I would highly recommend you finish it asap.

Original asker here.

Going to answer the H/SS question first because the answer's shorter - I still need to do those, I just haven't gotten around to doing the research on them so they're not in the schedule.

As for the 61A vs. 70 issue, in one word, my main reason for choosing 70 is "teachers".

I've heard great things about the TA teaching 70 over summer and I've found pretty much nothing about the TAs teaching 61A.

More importantly though, I'd really like to take 61A with DeNero and 61B with Hug.

I can't do either of those things if I take 61A over summer.

Gotcha.  I was considering taking CS 70 because of who was teaching and who would be teaching the future CS 61 classes.  But with limited time as a transfer, I opted to make some progress to open up my options in the final year.  Thanks for responding!

Hey there!  I'm also an incoming transfer student wanting to plan out my schedule.

I was debating CS61A or CS70.  Some recommended taking CS70 over the summer that way I totally focus on the class, but to me it seems that CS61A is a better option because it opens allows one to complete the CS61 series as soon as possible.  Could you talk about why you are deciding to take CS70 over CS61A in the summer?  Also, I need to take another course to be considered full time in the summer, so I thought pairing CS61A and an AC class would be a more manageable workload than CS70 and an AC.

Also, I notice you only have an AC class in your schedule.  Were you able to knock out your upper div H/SS prior to transferring?
